Billing_Schedule_TemplateObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Billing_Schedule_TemplateObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Billing_Schedule_TemplateObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Billing_Schedule_Template_Data.description: This field enables you to select attachment types of expense report and supplier invoice on the billing schedule template.

validation.validation: You can’t include attachments on invoices for award contract billing schedule templates.
To include attachments on invoices for installment billing schedule templates, specify a schedule type of Prepaid Billing.
validation.description: To include attachments on invoices for installment billing schedule templates, specify a schedule type of Prepaid Billing.

Billing_Schedule_Template_Data.description: If true, the Invoice will be submitted automatically for approval
If true, Review us not required for billing
if true, automatically Submit Schedule for Approval
If true, the Billing Schedule will re-generate installments automatically
If true, the Billing Schedule will be submitted automatically
If true, the Billing Schedule will Include Tax on Prepaid.

validation.validation: When the Billing Type is Installment and the Billing Method is not Custom, you must use Day of the Month, Use From Date, or Use to Date.
You can only use the Automatically Regenerate Installment option when the Billing Method is Spread Even.
You can only use the Amendment Auto Submit option when the Automatically Regenerate Installments option is selected.
Billing Method is required when Billing Type is Installment
You can only use Billing Cycle when the Billing Type is Transaction.
When the Billing Type is Installment and the Billing Method is not Custom, you must select a Billing Frequency.
When the Billing Type is Installment and the Billing Method is not Custom, you must select Generate Installment with To Date or the Number of Installments.
You must select only one grouping option.
When the Billing Type is Transaction and a Billing Frequency is set, you must use Day of the Month, Day of the Week, Use From Date, or Use to Date.
If you select the Use To Date check box in the Invoice Date Options, you must also select the Generate Installment with To Date check box.
You can only use Project Invoice Summary Definition when the Billing Type is Transaction.
You can only use Billing Method when the Billing Type is Installment.
You can't use Day of the Month when the Billing Frequency is Weekly.
You can only use Day of the Week when the Billing Frequency is Weekly and the Billing Type is Transaction.
You can only use Number of Installments when the Billing Type is Installment.
You can only use Billed in Arrears when the Billing Type is Transaction.
Include Tax on Prepaid is valid only if you select a prepaid schedule type.
